definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To knock (someone or something) down ; to cause to come down; to fell . [from 16th c.]
examples: The storm downed several old trees along the highway.
A single rifle shot downed the mighty beast.

subdefinitions.definition: ( transitive ) Specifically, to cause (something in the air) to fall to the ground ; to bring down (with a missile etc.). [from 19th c.]
examples: The helicopter was downed by a surface-to-air missile.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To lower ; to put (something) down. [from 16th c.]
examples: The bell rang for lunch, and the workers downed their tools.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , figurative ) To defeat ; to overpower . [from 17th. c.]
( transitive , colloquial ) To disparage ; to put down . [from 18th c.]
( intransitive , rare or obsolete ) To go or come down; to descend . [from 17th. c.]
( transitive , colloquial ) To drink or swallow , especially without stopping before the vessel containing the liquid is empty. [from 19th c.]
examples: He downed an ale and ordered another.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , American football , Canadian football ) To render (the ball ) dead , typically by touching the ground while in possession . [from 19th c.]
examples: He downed it at the seven-yard line.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , golf , pocket billiards ) To sink (a ball ) into a hole or pocket . [from 20th c.]
examples: He downed two balls on the break.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To knock (someone or something) down ; to cause to come down; to fell . [from 16th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To lower ; to put (something) down. [from 16th c.]
( transitive , figurative ) To defeat ; to overpower . [from 17th. c.]
( transitive , colloquial ) To disparage ; to put down . [from 18th c.]
( intransitive , rare or obsolete ) To go or come down; to descend . [from 17th. c.]
( transitive , colloquial ) To drink or swallow , especially without stopping before the vessel containing the liquid is empty. [from 19th c.]
( transitive , American football , Canadian football ) To render (the ball ) dead , typically by touching the ground while in possession . [from 19th c.]
( transitive , golf , pocket billiards ) To sink (a ball ) into a hole or pocket . [from 20th c.]

definitions.definition: To cover, ornament, line, or stuff with down.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cover, ornament, line, or stuff with down.
